intro: Kochia odontoptera, commonly known as the sharpleaf kochia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its upright, branching structure and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in late summer. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating, aiding in water retention. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Kochia odontoptera is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is known for its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
